comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Casement "Roger David Casement (Irish: Ruairí Dáithí Mac Easmainn; 1 September 1864 – 3 August 1916)—Sir Roger Casement Kt. CMG between 1911 and shortly before his execution for treason, when he was stripped of his British honours — was a humanitarian campaigner and an Irish patriot, poet, revolutionary, and nationalist."

comment._content: thanks for the background information.  We will update the record.

comment._content: Nobel Prize Mario Vargas Llosa novel El sueño del Celta (The Dream of the Celt) is about the life of Cassement.
